condition: $p \in \mathcal{P}(\mathbf{F})$ is a monic polynomial of smallest degree such that $p(T) = 0$
$r \in \mathcal{P}(\mathbf{F})$ is a monic polynomial of the same degree as $p$ and $r(T) = 0$

reason: If $p - r$ were not equal to 0, then we could divide $p - r$ by the coefficient of the highest-order term in $p - r$ to get a monic polynomial (of smaller degree than $p$) that when applied to $T$ gives the 0 operator.
